Award.AwardTitle: NeTS: SMALL: Reliable and Efficient Communication Support for Highly Mobile Ad Hoc Networks

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration: This project aims to build a reliable and efficient communication support for highly mobile ad hoc networks. This type of networks many time are mission or safety critical requiring reliable communication. For an ad hoc network, this problem is especially challenging because two communication nodes may have never encountered before and do not possibly belong to the same organization. Pre-sharing any information between two nodes may not be feasible. This project addresses a number of adversary attacks in highly mobile ad hoc networks, including communication jamming and eavesdropping, by building a supporting communication layer. More precisely, the main research in this project is to design novel schemes to defend against jamming attacks by agilely changing communication channels, and extract physical layer information to build a secure communication channel. The supporting communication layer provides a secure infrastructure for efficient communications. The project applies both theoretical analysis and real experiments to validate the solutions.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Qun Li has completed the research on "Reliable and Efficient Communication Support for Highly Mobile Ad Hoc Networks". The project aims to provide protocols to improve reliability and efficiency for  vehicular networks, mobile cognitive radio networks, and mobile RFID networks. In particular, four protocols were proposed, designed, and tested: 1. efficient channel hopping scheme for two communication nodes to communicate in the face of a jamming attack, 2. secret sharing between two vehicles by using captured RSSI signals, 3. detect a mobile rogue AP disguising itself as a legitimate AP, 4. optimize performance for a mobile RFID reader. In all the proposed research components, the research objectives have been successfully met, that is, all the proposed research problems have been resolved and more further study has been conducted to answer more related questions.

More precisely, the intellectual merits of the project are demonstrated by the following aspects. In efficient channel hopping scheme, the fundamental theory behind the optimal communication scheme is discovered. In secret sharing between vehicles, RSSI signal based secret sharing is realized for the first time in history. In mobile rogue AP detection scheme, a case of a new rogue AP is presented and an effective solution is proposed to address the attack. In mobile RFID reading scheme, a large experimental study has been conducted and the relationship between reading performance and various parameters has been characterized.

The project has trained a number of graduate students, undergraduate students, and high school students. The effort in outreach to underrepresented students includes supervising one African American student in REU project, and four female graduate students for research projects.

The project has provide support and resources for the group to publish more ten journal papers and more than 20 conference papers. All the discoveries obtained in this project have been disseminated through published papers, conference talks, and so on.
